subject: RE: [junit] JUnit remote execution and TestDirector
msgSnippet: Hi Mike, Thanks for your mail. EnhancedJUnit is really quite interesting adn I am going to try it. I still have problem to run JUnit tests from TestDirector
messageBody:
Hi Mike,

Thanks for your mail.
EnhancedJUnit is really quite interesting adn I am going to
try it.

I still have problem to run JUnit tests from TestDirector 7.6.
The VAPI-XP tool does not work properly! If anyone managed to
use it for Java/Junit please tell me how!

Eric.



Enhanced JUnit uses remote test execution agents to run JUnit
tests
remotely. That is, it uses remote test execution agents to
distribute
JUnit tests to other machines and get back results.

The URL is: http://www.javatesting.com/Product/enhancedjunit/

Please feel free to contact me directly with technical
questions, as
I've had TD integration on my list of to-dos for a long time
and would
be happy to help.

- Mike

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein          
SilverMark, Inc.
The Object Testing Company
www.javatesting.com



> -----Original Message-----
> From: eric.riou-du-cosquer [mailto:eric.riou-du-
cosquer@...]
> Sent: Friday, December 20, 2002 11:11 AM
> To: junit
> Subject: [junit] JUnit remote execution and TD
>
>
>
>
> Hello there,
>
> I am going to use Test Director's facilities for a remote
>
> JUnit tests execution.
>
> For this I have to create different things:
>
> - a Remote Agent class
>
> - a test type plug-in for JUnit
>
> ...
>
> Even if it is well documented, it would be a nice Xmas
present
>
> for me to have a sample of such an integration. Has someone
>
> already done that???
>
> Many thanks in advance,
>
>
>
> Eric RIOU
>
